oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Irving Block Prison in downtown Memphis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Copy engraving depicts "Forrest's Raiders Attacking Irvin[g] Prison" on August 22, 1864. Taken from a September 10, 1864, Harper's Weekly, sketched by George H. Ellsbury. Gen. Nathan B. Forrest's cavalry carried out a daring daytime raid on Memphis, attacking the Irving Prison and Gayoso Hotel. Courtesy of the Bartlett Historical Society.
